39104388.review: Overall, a very nice museum experience. There's quite a bit of art, as the museum covers two floors and has multiple rooms off to the side. There's plenty to look at and read. The control mechanics are well designed in my opinion, though I would like to see smooth locomotion.

38899498.review:
Dear friends, and developers. I'v encountered a problem in several games, most recently The VR Museum..... The problem is that I am handicaped and confined to a chair. When I run TVMFA I find myself with my head, eye level, in the counter. with no way to move using the controllers.
  When I spent the money to move up to VR, I had hopes of experiencing things, like this museum, even though I could not physically be present. 
 Most of the VR games I have used expext me to be able to move physically (I.E. HEAD. HANDS) instead of providing controller, or keyboard, interface for movement.
Hope this helps to make your product more successful,  
PS.. why not start a "HANDICAP ACCESABLE" label for your tours once they are fixed. I would be happy to serve as a product tester/representative for handicaped VR users.
Rev. Gary Utz (retired)

38841113.review:
Vintage VR is a free VR program that puts you in a small Museum. It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok. 

Try it, maybe you might like it.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lUEaLdnJhNs

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mln-VjjAoD0

38681557.review:
This app is really good.  Feels like you are in a real museum.  My only criticism is that the pieces are organized in a very odd manner.

38631162.review:
The VR Museum of Fine Art

38480689.review: The first floor is stunning. We need more VR apps like this! I originally bought it so I could do a joke review that would reference a game that had a VR art museum in it, but it was legitimagely badass. I loved the ancient civilizations exhibit! The second floor wasn't as great and the elevator gave me slight motion sickness, but that's down to personal taste, not a lack of quality. Definitely check this out!

38429467.review: 没啥游戏性，但是创意挺不错的，但是更适合作为美术生的学习教育一类用途，对htc vive的交互做的是我见过最漂亮的了，也难怪是美术展览的主题，模型的shader做的很棒尤其是兵马俑的质感，室内打光有点问题，考虑到VR游戏市场有限，开发者没精力没动力做好细节也理解，毕竟现在的玩家和读者都太浮躁，期待后续题材的美术展览（比如二战？日本和风题材），刚买来VR不知道要玩什么的人，这款游戏有助于你适应对VR的操作

35743542.review: Wonderfull intro to VR. Exibits are amazing.

35556712.review:
This product is free. As such, the determination for if it is recommend is, is it worth your time?

This is not a game, but simply an interactive museum. It's short, but very interesting. If you've ever enjoyed an art museum in real life, this will let you go to one without having to deal with another person. The 3D scans of the artwork are beautiful.

35142413.review:
Nothing too bad about it other than the lack of art pieces - one of the paintings is superb but half of them have poor resolution.

Tip: you need to point to the floor to teleport - at first I thought it wasn’t working with the Oculus Touch but it is not the case.

Still recommending as it is free to experience.

34955109.review: Wer sich für Kunst interessiert kann hier fündig werden. Sehr gut aus modelierte Skulpturen und selbst auf den Gemälden hat man das Gefühl das die Beschaffenheit des Papiers nachgeahmt wird. Auch mit einigen informativen Texten auf Englisch.

34714947.review: Fine art indeed! its free, educational and visually pleasing =). One peeve I had was the looped soundtrack in the Terra Cotta exhibition, a small peeve but the soundtrack got annoying after a while when trying to admire details of the soldiers in the dig.

34712888.review:
The idea is very interesting, I'd love a virtual museum in which to see famouse works of art and being able to get really close and in the comfort of home; however, this demo lacks in content (but this is understandable since it's free) and quality: the 3d models of the artworks are not that great, most are really low resolution and from what I can recall from some things I have seen IRL the scale of the statues is not really portrayed realistically.
VR would be an excellent medium for this type of content: imagine an Art History class about classic statues and being able to look at them in 3D closely, moving around them (also, some statues are on a pedestal, I don't see the point, bring them down so one can inspect them more carefully!), I hope this kind of projects get expanded

34338000.review: Is good. Good quality and straight forward. Although it needs many more pieces. Excellent being free!

34223119.review: Great app, great start to the VR community of museum apps too.  I really hope they keep developing this, the potential is huge!  Haven't had an update in awhile though it looks like which is unfortunate.

33964911.review: This was my first VR experience.  Now I want to see more art!

33796240.review: Truely amazing and spectacular. Not exactly like seeing the mona lisa, but comes pretty darn close, truly do recommend

33786235.review: 个人认为非常优秀的VR应用。这种感觉真有身临其境之感。说两个不足之处吧，第一是需要中文啊！！！！再有就是别的展品我虽然没有见过实物，但是兵马俑我看过多次，兵马俑真的不是这样的。比游戏中的要高大很多，并且比例也更协调。

33119808.review:
OMG ............. this is truely amazing experience. I haven't even done the entire musuem just yet. After doing the first floor and had to come here and leave a review.  I've seen Art and sculptures I thought I'd never see in my lifetime just on the first floor of this museum.  It's like actually being there plus as, one reviewer already stated, you can get up close and personal with the pieces.  In a real musuem you'd be in handcuffs and at the very least, the  voice of your mom yelling at you to stop touching things.  I expect amazing things in the future from this young developer Finn Sinclair.  I hope he keeps his vision alive and pushes this even further.  Once you try it, you'll get what I mean.  The experience is amazing, just WOW. Imagaine expanding all disciplines into the musuem, like science, astrology, meterology, paleontology, culture, omg I could go on and on. What an amazing new way to expose people to the world and students into learning.

I donated 20 bucks right after coming out and I never donate.  It's that good imo.

Wish there were more rooms and loved one particular room but don't want to give it away. Amazing job!!!!

30842112.review: Should be labeled the VR Museum of Nude Art

30768374.review: The experience is pretty much exactly like a real museum, minus the sore feet. Extraordinarily well done!

30692792.review: 很好很艺术 只是兵马俑有那么矮小吗？

30610533.review:
VR美術館の中を歩き回って美術品を鑑賞できるソフトです。
特に油絵の質感の再現がすごいです。
PCモニタで見る画像ファイルとは全く違う。
思わずじっくりと見入ってしまいました。

ガラス張りのエレベーターで上下する感覚も面白い。フワワってなる。
利用するのは１度か２度なので酔うことはないと思います。

あと２階の奥にBusts.と書かれた展示室がありますが、胸像コーナーですからね？
何を期待してるんですかまったくもう。ありますけどね女性のバストも。

30578023.review: It's fine, but not really anything like as good as seeing the exhibits for real in a museum. I just couldn't help thinking about the fact they weren't real. Also the freedom of movement isn't very good, making it hard to turn round in the Vive's standing mode using the teleport button. Getting the wires of my Vive tangled round the chair as I looked at the Mona Lisa was completely frustrating and now I'm likely to associate that with the Mona Lisa in future. It would have been helpful to sit at the location of a bench placed in front of the exhibit, and have that lock your orientation. Instead, the red benches obscure your field of view when you try to pretend you are sitting on them. The textures on the exhibits are quite good, but not very detailed. They look artificial, especially before they are fully resolved. It's quite hard to find the best location to view an exhibit from, so you tolerate wherever the teleport places you. It ends up being a bit of a compromise and you don't feel like hanging around as you might in a museum. In some ways, it feels like a boring video game more than a museum experience. Somebody with a short attention span and not much interest in fine art might decide that this is all there is to it, and that would be a shame. It's a valiant effort, quite educational and interesting to a point, but not awe inspiring like it should be when you see great works of art for the first time.

30457707.review:
Very cool. Hope the exhibits change every so often. Am keen to go back. "A'a" was wonderfull. If possible the 'shine' when viewing the main room (spectral flair) could be reduced - we have the same problem in real gallaries but there we just have to put up with it. Matt is king.

Well done. More please!

30383567.review: This is an awesome experience! The VR museum has a nice collection and it's amazing to see the scale of some of them. Turning toe corner to see the sitting buddha in all it's size and glory was fantastic!

30349916.review:
This is an amazing experience. Shows VRs potential way beyond and above gaming. Makes me a little afraid we will never leave our living rooms in the future because this is just like being in a museum.
I hope it continues to expand and I would not mind paying if that would help. Truly a work of art in and of itself.

30233340.review: Not going to lie, I thought this was going to be some cheap looking deal, thought there's no way that art could look any good in a Vive with the SDE.  Well, I was wrong.  There's some familiar pieces here, and plenty that were new to me.  It really is a VR Museum.  They did a great job and it's worth your time to take at least a quick tour.

30159072.review:
I once visited Kykuit, the estate of the Rockefeller family—possibly the wealthiest family in human history. I thought it was so cool that they had a multi-story art museum in their house.

Now I have a multi-story art museum in my house. And so can you, for the very reasonable price of FREE.

Virtual reality is fucking awesome.

30096430.review: awesome, just awesome.  Much respect to the dev for making it free.  The statues are excellent and the shadows and lighting make them so realistic.  The lighting on the paintings and how they move with your movement add to the realism.  I feel like I'm in an actual museum, despite the plain empty feeling.  In the future I hope it can expand.  Imagine the possibilities!

29760689.review: Great little demo, and it's free! What more could you ask for?

29756692.review: Mein Fall ist es nicht so ,Aber mein mann findet es mega ,Der Fahrstuhl ist gewohnungs bedurftig beim ersten mal wuste ich nicht das ich mich nur reinstellen brauch,aber was ich wünder schön finde ist der Budda mit Schnee ich könnte da stundenlang drinne bleiben .ok genug gelabert probiert es mal aus aber vergesst den budda nicht .

29751861.review: Stunning texture details, easy to control and move around. Can't wait to show my friends. Please add more paintings and sculptures.

29727730.review:
A great collection of sculpture scans that are very high quality. I've always wonder how big the terracotta army figures are. One sculpture was on the cover of my Latin book in high school, so it's amazing to finally come face to face with it. Lots of well-known touchstones and a massive outdoor statue. This is a collection that would be very difficult to see IRL because they reside in so many different locations.

The upper floor was just added. It's got some interesting sculptures too. The new paintings are a big letdown despite being able to understand their scale. They have a repeating canvas pattern specular highlight, but topographically have no relation to the painting. I know it would be incredibly difficult to scan accurately, but I feel like without that element they're not worth displaying. Seeing some of Van Gogh's work in person completely changed my perspective on them and flat versions completely misrepresent them.

But, you can't beat free, and in fact you should probably donate a few dollars so they can continue to expand this awesome project.

29681971.review: Surprisingly close to the experience of being in a museum. Definitely worth downloading.

29657483.review: It's free! And really nice. While it does not have very much content yet, the content it does have is of really nice quality. I hope more will get added over time (workshop perhaps? Or collaborating with different museums?). Since it's free just pick it up! Probably also nice for demoing the vive.

29515485.review: OH MY GAWT, MUCH REALLISTIC, SO ARWSOME

29407079.review: Great proof of concept, it left me wanting more. VR allows one to get closer to the art than most museums would let you.

29346120.review: It's essentially a tech demo of what a full VR museum could be. But it's free and worth your time to experience on it's own. I can't wait to see what they make next.

29298623.review:
喜欢艺术品、逛博物馆的强烈推荐！
模型建模十分精细，大理石雕塑的建模，质感和细腻程度可以乱真了，不过近距离观察还是有差距，比较精细的纹理还是难以展现

29174818.review: I feel like the term Fine Art is rather pretentious. I"ll stick to my comic books and marvel cards. THANKS.

29171776.review: Very cool and an interesting use of vr

29171068.review:
Je ne regrette pas mon achat même si le musée est très réduit. Mais cela montrer le potentiel incroyable une fois encore des casques VR. J'ai pris plaisir à vraiment me balader, lire... L'ambiance sonore est bonne, on peut admirer des oeuvres à taille réalle ! La définition est bonne, on peu s'approcher de très près, tourner partout, ...Seul souci, le texte en anglais. Mais je me  fais plaisir en imaginant des visites de musées connus du monde entier, de lieux historiques, de monuments, etc... Les années à venir vont être fantastiques..; Je l'espère. On ne peut pas tout voir sur terre, mais je trouve que les casques VR nous rapprochent plutôt bien de certains endroits où nous n'iront jamais ! Et au niveau pédagogique, c'est top ! J'imagine même des reconstitutions de faits historiques, ou à notre époque des enregistrement en 360 de grands moments. 
Quelle époque !!

29157218.review: This project is amazing and well worth the download. I only wish there was more to it.

29121359.review: Neat program. Simple and enjoyable. Glad to have it in my collection!

29118694.review: One of my favourite VR experiences. Incedibly immersive.

29104344.review: This is really well done! Congrats!

i can poke mona lisa without getting in trouble

28986402.review:
Ein tolles (kostenloses) Stück Software!

Das "Museum" und die Exponate sind gut gestaltet und alles wird sehr ansprechend präsentiert. Ich wünschte mir schlicht mehr content, aber hey, ich habe ja nichtmal was gezahlt.

Daumen hoch.

28984743.review: Great expirience and fun to actually be able to get so close to the pieces, something that you can't do in real life. If you like art or history, give this a try.

28918163.review:
A very well nice and crisply designed fine art museum experience which showcases the unique power of Virtual Reality as a medium for exhibition.

https://youtu.be/lUEaLdnJhNs

28876609.review: Definitely worth it for the price of Free. The sculptures look great, and if you like this sort of stuff you can almost imagine it's real history you're looking at.

28850295.review: Very impressive. I recomend. Please do more!

28674462.review:
[b]Sehr schönes Proof of Concept, bei dem es dann leider doch an Umfang und Details mangelt.[/b]

Die Grundidee ist super und zeigt hervorragend, wie VR auch Nicht-Spieler begeistern könnte oder ggf. sogar in Schulen und ähnlichem Verwendung finden könnte. Nicht jede Schule kann sich Schulausflüge an historische Stätten oder in Museen leisten (gut, den VR-fähigen PC dann wohl eher auch nicht), aber mir gefällt die grundlegende Idee/Richtung sehr gut.

Wie schon in anderen Reviews erwähnt wurde, die Modelle sind detailliert, aber gerade aus der Nähe dann teils doch extrem grob bzw. vereinfacht. Ich bin mir leider nicht ganz sicher, wo der Umfang des ganzen „Spiels“ herkommt, denn es gibt ja doch nur eine Handvoll Räume mit jeweils einigen Bildern oder Skulpturen. Insgesamt trotzdem ein interessantes Einsteigererlebnis, insbesondere für jene, die sich an VR herantasten wollen und sich sonst eher für Geschichte, Kunst oder Bildung interessieren und eben weniger für Spiele.

28615594.review: A great free experience. My parents loved it!

28455016.review: Marvelous curation of artifacts. There was nobody working at the service desk, but I took the pamphlet and it was very helpful. I made sure not to sully the exhibits. [spoiler]Anatomically correct statues abounds, mum![/spoiler] http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=849555033

28411859.review: Not much replayability, but super cool to at least check out. Especially enjoyed the Terracotta Army.

28318654.review: Excellent work.  It is so realistic that it gives you that relaxing and calm feeling as if you really were at a museum.  Hope more exhibits are added.

28286310.review:
This is a really cool virtual museum of some very important art pieces. The information is informative and interesting, and is concise enough to not be too strenuous to read; as much as I still dislike reading in VR. 

Unfortunately, some of the statue models aren't of the highest quality. They're very accurate and beautiful, but they get a little rough if you're too close. The sound effects are a nice touch!

Overall, it's hard to complain about something that's free. I'm not even an art nut and I really enjoyed it.

7/10!

27751501.review: Very well made. It has very good information to go along with the art. This is wonderful in it's current form, and anything additional is just icing on the cake. It is very cool being right up next to famous art pieces and learning some context behind them.

27689023.review: Very simple yet very convincing. Looks super nice, I would really like to see more.

27655421.review: 'Coming soon: the SETTING AND OPTIONS museum cafe'  Yea a museum that starts with humor! This is my museum :) Nice little looksy at a few items. I'm keeping this, to see where their heading!

27528653.review: Read the back of the pamphlet. Mr Finn Sinclair where do i donate to keep this project going.

26701819.review: A nice but too small discovery of VR museum experiences. I wish models could be even higher quality, and hope to see more, much more content.

26674011.review:
A lovely proof of concept that gets me excited about VR all over again, it's definitely worth downloading and exploring. I really hope that the developers continue to expand on it. I'd love to see more paintings in the gallery, and I'm looking forward to the expanded graphic settings options.


There are only two things I would change, if I could:

The pamplet is nice, but it gets distracting and in the way sometimes. It would be nice to be able to hide it, possibly with the trackpad? Press up to pull it out, down to put it away, or something like that?

It would be nice to be able to see the sculptures from different heights. Flying would be ideal, but just being able to jump to a few points in the air surrounding the sculptures would work fine as well.


Thank you so much for sharing this project!

26586880.review: A nice but too small discovery of VR museum experiences. I wish models could be even higher quality, and hope to see more, much more content.

26469061.review: The pamphlet is really annoying. It kept switching between my hands as I was moving about. Otherwise, it's exactly what I was hoping for. The modeling of the statues, the atmosphere, it's all very well done. The paintings look especially good, as if I am looking at the real thing.

26316227.review:
Wow, I didn't really care for educational use of VR but this game(?) made me a believer.
The level of quality in the game is amazing. If you can make a whole museum this way this could be a great way of education for the new generation!

Great work Devs!

26185882.review: idéal pour démarrer avec le casque, se rassurer de son achat (pour la définition) et se deplacer dans cet espace en restant immobile.

26107580.review: Loved it. Very intuitive idea for VR

26095845.review: Love being able to get right up next to famous paintings.  The painting are detailed enough that you can see the texture of the oil paintings.

26040310.review: fantastic. well worth your time to download and the disc space required. cant wait to see updates to this

26005138.review:
This experience is fantastic, really looking forward to future updates. Pro tip - use only one controller because the pamphlet (which is required to start the tour) switches between hands if the controllers are near to each other when both controllers are on, and it's a bit distracting.

A dumb/fun thing to try - Put your head through some of the sculptures to get a different perspective on things. For example, Michelanglo's Pietà, wonderful 3D model, I put my head through the Virgin Mary's head and see her holding Jesus's body in first person. You can't do that at the Vatican now can you???

25936343.review:
This is a genius idea which works really good for VR. The paintings and sculptures are very detailed and look amazingly realistic. It's a perfect experience to showcase to friends and family to give them an idea of how VR can be used besides just for obvious things such as games.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XSvHf9OM0o

25739804.review:
not much to see unfortunately...
but its free and some of the scans are VERY high res and detailed!
wish there was audio commentary instead of having to read everything

25711392.review:
Really cool way to see some unique art from around the world. I'd love to see it expanded, perhaps to include entire museum collections.

Well implimented and easy to use/navigate. My only complaint is that I kept getting distracted by the brochure swapping between my two hands when I moved them close to each other, but that's a minor niggle. Otherwise a really great experience and well worth a go especially considering it's free.

If any more exhibts are added in I'll definatly get back in this.

25702780.review:
As someone that recently got into art, I really enjoyed this game. The sculptures seem like they're right there in front of you, same goes for the paintings. And if you have museum etiquette and don't try to touch the art works, it's almost real. When you move up close, you see the proper imperfections in the paintings. 
All I would ask the developers to do is to include more paintings! The only downside is how quickly you go through all of the works. I mostly enjoy paintings, and I indulged in the Mona Lisa and the Birth of Venus, but I wish I had something more. A Hopper or a Monet, perhaps?

25643040.review:
Great demonstration of how VR can be used for non-game experiences.  I hope this product (and others like it) get the love and support they need for developers to keep creating content.  

I knew from 2nd hand accounts that the Statue of David was very large and that the Mona Lisa was actually quite small but getting the chance to experience them in VR was something pictures and video could never do.  Being able to put my face up to the Mona Lisa was very cool knowing that in reality I could never get so close.  

Sure, nothing beats actual reality, but I really think this experience provides a glimpse at how VR can be used educationally and culturally, which is important for the technology.  Add a few more exhibits and I'd happily pay for this.

25623761.review: I really enjoyed the brief tour. The sounds really add to the experience and made the atmosphere great. I really wish to see more exhibitions and more educational games like this in general for Vive. This one will definitely be in my choise of things to show when doing demos of Vive for friends.

25561280.review:
Exactly what it says on the tin: the VR Museum of Fine Art. It's also the best "educational" VR experience I've encounted, by far. You wander through several rooms with various real-world artifacts, sculptures, and paintings. Informative plaques come into view as you approach various objects.

Technically, there is zero lag and no wonky controls. Movement is quick and fluid. Graphically, everything is very well-defined and sharp. There's no visual stuttering or nausea-inducing low FPS that plague certain other educational apps. The text throughout the museum is clear and readable.

A job well done. I definitely look forward to seeing this expand over time.

25511312.review:
It has all the bits and pieces it needs to really shine. It is let down by some odd design choices though.
If any of the concerns I'm about to list are explained in a menu somewhere, then I guess I just missed it.
Once I had picked up the brochure/guide, there was no way for me to hide or drop it. That in itself isn't a problem. The problem was having it swap between hands within a certain proximity and making a little 'swish' noise when that happened. I felt like I wanted to stand in front of the exibits with my hands by my sides, doing so left my hands just close enough together to get a 'swish,swish,swish,swish', as the brochure swapped back and forth between my two hands.
Second little gripe is similar. I couldn't see how, other than backing away from an exibit, to hide the exibits name and description, which appears as text within a floating box. In the case of the statue of David, it appears directly in front of the statue itself, obstructing the view from in front. This would not be a problem if I could turn these titles and descriptions on and off.
Lastly, I would say the lighting of some of the exibits is poorly placed. The Mona Lisa can't be viewed well from directly in front because there is a light reflecting off it's surface that washes out the entire face. Maybe move her to a room of her own with some upward facing lights that bounce off the ceiling? Not sure what engine this is running in but even unity does some pretty nice stuff with global illumination and bounced lights. 
Minor gripes. As I said, everything is already here for a great VR experience.
Also, at that price, it's pretty easy to recommend this.

25503586.review: Excellent demo of whats to come. I've visited most of the museums which the art in this demo provides. It does a great job recreating them and letting you comprehend the size and emotion behind the art. Definitely worth a try.

25493069.review: Exatctly as described a nice little museum.

25405232.review: This was really cool, not very much to it yet, but it has a lot of promise!

25374070.review:
You might think going to a virtual museum is not very interesting. Isn't the point of going to a museum to actually seeing the art in real life? Well, yes. But this is awesome. It would have great potential as an educational tool. It's not the same as actually being there but when you can put on a HMD and walk around a museum and see classic art pieces, it's very neat!

And it's free! Definitely worth checking out!

25364980.review: Very cool museum experience, excellent use of VR to see stuff up close as you may never get the chance to do in person. Easy to navigate, easy to read, awesome to explore and admire. I hope there's more to come.

25353095.review: I liked this experience because it was very educational. I wish for more to explore as I finished the galleries. Maybe the developer can add to experience by taking us to different levels of the museum to see and read about more art.

25339475.review: Very cool, hopefully more exhibits will continue to be added. Thank you for your hard work on this project, Finn Sinclair.

25298386.review: Cool experience, some of the 3d scans are really fantastic (especially with the quality slider jacked up all the way to 2.5) - you can see the brushstrokes on the paintings and the wooden head of the woman was quite realistic.  Great example of how VR will be useful for much more than gaming.   This one is free, everyone with a vive should try it out!

25293718.review:
Great art showed in great detail and surprising sceneries (that couldn't be used in a real world). I'll visit it more. You can almos touch them all :)
One thing to improve IMO is the ability to shake off the leaflet or at least remove the annoying sound of shuffling it between hands.

25255165.review: Really great and nice experience. Seems like a real museum. Visuals are clean and ambiant sounds well chosen. More exhibits would be fine. One point: maybe too much brightness which is inconvenient when looking at Mona Lisa and other canvas.

25235523.review: Super gemacht, hohe Auflösung der meisten Kunstgegenstände.

25234083.review:
Definately a must... This should hopefully be a 
continues prosject that never really ends but constantly gets new materiall..
Deserves public funding...
Very nicely done...

25212969.review: Fantastic reminder of the past of humanity. If only all the world's art could be preserved in one VR space...

25212628.review: I hope this continues to evolve with more exhibits. One of the exhibits is suddenly outside, which was really striking and added to the whole experience. It's a short trip, but worth it. Maybe there can be a donation box that links to the developers paypal in the future.

25207785.review:
Update:
The developer has updated the application, so here's the update.

The update adds a second storey to the title, essentially double the content of the virtual museum. The main 2nd floor common area adds more paintings, and within each rooms, more sculptures and paintings. There are some new comestic changes, for example, there's a new elevator which brings the user between floors now. Teleportation used to be an arc but now it is a straight line.

Original:
The content is a little lacking, but it is understandable, considering the creator spend like 3 months on this. However so far, I am liking what I see currently and I certainly hope this application gets fleshed out in the future. In fact, some organisations should probably fund this project to expand the scope.

The sculptures are nice to look at , but I think it will be better if there are a couple of background ambience musics which the users can choose to play while they view the art works.

There's also little problem though. I used this app in a seated position. I went down into the terracotta statues area, and I don't think there's anyway for me to climb up. I have to stand up (physically) to highlight and reach the floor with the controller. I hope there's a way to climb back up when I am down in the teractta area without standing up physically

Overall this is a short yet nice and calming experience.

25169827.review: Very nice quality of the sculptures. The sound loop got a bit repetitive though, and I wish the pamphlet could easily be dropped (it kept jumping between my left and right hand).

25153410.review: Absolutely awesome - a fantastic resource for the whole world!

25105546.review: A great fun and free experience.  While currently a small selection, it is very well done.  This is along the quality of what I would expect form an actual museum making a VR project.  I look forward to any updates. Very impressive for only 3 months by 1 high school student.

25102431.review: Now I can finally look at a gigantic knob in VR and look at fine art at the same time, 5/7 perfect score GOTY 2018 :^)

25092200.review: Oh my goodness, this will revolutionize the way you experience Art. Thank you so much for giving access to these treasures for ... virtually .. anyone on earth.

25073028.review:
Well, Sir,  Had This Game For Two [2] Days.  When Bring Game Up Only Part Of Game Can Be Seen At Top.  Starting At Middle There Es A Dark Rectangle.  Tried Everything To Play Game, Restart, Verifing Files Deleted Game, Reinstalled And So On.  Tried Moving, Yet Could Move Not Und Can Find The Options Not.

Have To Give This Game A Thumbs Down.  :)

25066787.review: Great concept and start. I wish the models and textures were a bit higher resolution, but I can't complain too much at this price

25066422.review:
I appreciate what this is attempting (combining art / art history and VR is great, plus its free). However this is really basic right now. The museum environment is so basic and bland that it takes away from the art pieces. 

What I found surprising was looking at the paintings up close was more interesting to me than the sculptures. I think this is because even at maximum model detail level, the scultpures aren't all that detailed if you get close.

I'd really like the rooms to be bigger, have some more dramatic/varied lighting, and one really simple thing would be to put a city background/skybox outside, like outside the front doors and above the skylight. Also its great to have the info text, but the big floating block of text detracts from  an immersive museum experience. That information could be put into a nearby podium or sign of some sort instead.

I hate to have this be a bad review because I'd love this thing to get fleshed out, but at the same time this could be so much better. It sounds like this will be getting some updates so I'll certainly update my review in the future if that's the case.

25060965.review: Great way of exploring art, hope for many more content. This is, beside games, the best way to use VR.

25060507.review:
[h1]Graphic [/h1]
Wonderful, but the sculptures got a huge difference in the quality of the scans and the texture resolution. But all of the models are very good fixed after scanning. There are no recognizable holes in the models or scan shadows. Also the textures are very fine here is the display resolution the bottleneck for the experience.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aaEV0NsemnA

The Textures are so fine you can push your head against the canvas to see the little details. 
For the bump mapping (relief map) it looks for the most models like a random and titled image, some other looks like real scanned artifacts. 

[h1]Sound [/h1]
“Buy now our CD for 19.99€ to turn your home into a museum too…” some Simpson gag long time ago. Here it makes the same feeling of fake museums tour. Some nice little classic music would be more fitting.

[h1]Let’s museum [/h1]
[url= https://youtu.be/aaEV0NsemnA]German let’s play [/url]
But it’s free so watch it yourself. 

[h1]Result [/h1]
The marble texture is maybe a fake on the models, but looks very nice. For the future it can be helping for researcher to see different exhibit around the world, if the 3D scans are more detailed. 

For the cultural estate for the far distant children of us this is a very good way to preserve this civilization treasure. Stone and paint into dust someday but we can save the data.

I hope this will be a first steppingstone into a VR ark of the fine arts.

25058126.review: Great concept and realization, and a very promising educational use of the VR medium.  Thank you very much for it, and here's hoping this will be expanded upon in the future (with others contributing objects)!

25058061.review: This is going on the go-to list of things to show friends who are new to VR. It's a great experience. They also did a great job selecting and laying out the pieces, so it feels more like a unique museum and not like a VR flip-book of art. Looking forward to more!

25055509.review: Nice experiment. Nicely crafted. Run well on Win7 (not just Win10 as written in the configuration)

This is a great beginning of virtual museum exhibition and I recommend highly to download this!

25047776.review: This is an excellent start, there's not really anything else like it. The terracotta soldiers were impressive. I can imagine with more exhibits this would be like 'Night at the Museum'. Well worth the download.

25047606.review: Very nice. I hope, that creators will extend the gallery and keep resolution higher - like in "Appolo and Daphna" and even more. Authors did a great job, I am ready to pay for such a product to support further development and scans.

25045444.review: If you're into art or history this is great! You can't beat the price, either. I look forward to more exhibits.

25044185.review:
While only short (at the moment?) and not particular high resolution, it gives a good example of why VR should succeed. MoFA allows you to see the scale of real world (in this case art) objects. 
I’ve spent some time in space and various other fantasy scenes in VR, but this along with Destinations / Realities and The Lab photogrammetry are the ones that leave the lasting impression of the future of VR.
 I’ve seen the Mona Lisa; it is as underwhelming IRL as it is in VR. To be able to choose what art or culture you appreciate by actually seeing it (scale is the key) will be amazing.

25042447.review:
While it may be a short experience at the moment, it's one that's definitely worth checking out! The ambient sounds and the little pamphlet you get at the start of the 'tour' really go a long way in immersing you and making you feel like you're actually in a museum.

I'm definitely going to keep popping back into this museum whenever new stuff gets added!

25040838.review:
Kostenloser Museumsbesuch mit berühmten Ausstellungsstücken.

Das Konzept ist überzeugend umgesetzt, ich freu mich auf die nächsten Updates.

25040507.review: Wow - Very nice free & educative experience, really shows the endless possibilities of VR; Hope the developer expands it even further!

25039367.review:
This is fantastic! It captures the feel of being in a museum perfectly, there is a surprising amount of content given that it is free too.

Definitely one to demo to friends and family.
